SEARCH
Package boundary

Class ConsoleUI

Object
ConsoleUI
public class ConsoleUI extends Object

This class handles ui of the console. Implements a simple state machine with a STATE enum to keep track of UI state. Each UI state has a respective Menu class.

Since:
19-11-2023
Version:
1.0
Author:
Sim Yi Wan Terence

    Enum class used to represent states in state machine.

      Represents the current state

    • stateDirty

      private boolean stateDirty
      Tracks if state needs to be refreshed. Dirty means to check to change states.

      Input class to handle input using Scanner

      DI for login system ui depends on loginsystemm to know state

  • Method Details

    • setStateDirty

      public void setStateDirty(boolean dirty)
      Setter for stateDirty.
      Parameters:
      dirty - whether state is dirty

    • getUser

      public User getUser()
      Getter for user object.

    • getInput

      public Input getInput()
      Getter for input object. Call this to do user input.
      Returns:
      input object

    • init

      public void init(LoginSystem loginSystem, CampSystem campSystem, EnquirySystem enquirySystem, SuggestionSystem suggestionSystem, ReportSystem reportSystem)
      Initializes all menus, creates state map. Uses dependency injection to pass systems to menus.
      Parameters:
      loginSystem - loginSystem object
      campSystem - campSystem object
      enquirySystem - enquirySystem object
      suggestionSystem - suggestionSystem object
      reportSystem - reportSystem object
      feedbackSystem - feedbackSystem object

    • run

      public boolean run()
      Main update loop of app. Uses state machine design. Checks if state is dirty and calls switchStates
      Returns:
      returns if should exit app

    • cleanup

      public void cleanup()
      Function to cleanup systems

    • switchState

      private void switchState()
      Function to change states, by setting state variable and checking preconditions
